title: Ray Davies, Americana - The Kinks, The Road and The Perfect Riff
description:
As a boy in post-War England, legendary Kinks singer/songwriter Ray Davies fell in love with America Ã¢â‚¬â€œ its movies and music, its culture of freedom fed his imagination.

In Americana, Davies tries to make sense of his long love-hate relationship with the country that both inspires and frustrates him, and where he nearly lost his life in a street shooting.

Some of the most fascinating characters in pop culture and the British Invasion make appearances, from the famous to the behind-the-scenes players. The book is interspersed with lyrics and also includes photographs from Davies's own collection and the KinksÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ archive.

From his quintessentially English perspective, Davies Ã¢â‚¬â€œ with candour, humour, and wit Ã¢â‚¬â€œ takes us on a very personal road trip through his life and storied career as a rock star, and reveals what music, fame and America really mean to him
